title: Russia's Putin says no proof Iran was behind Saudi attacks
text:
[MOSCOW] Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Wednesday that there was no evidence that Iran was responsible for an attack on Saudi oil infrastructure last month and that the United States had not presented any proof of Iran's role.

France tried to set up a meeting between the leaders of Iran and the United States after the attack but failed to because Tehran wants Washington to remove its sanctions, Mr Putin said at an energy conference in Moscow.

"We condemn these (attacks) but we are against shifting the blame to Iran because there is no proof of that," Mr Putin said, adding that Iranian President Hassan Rouhani had personally told him Tehran had nothing to do with the attacks.

Last month's attack briefly reduced Saudi Arabia's oil output by half, causing a spike in oil prices, but Riyadh has been able to quickly restore production, calming the market.

sentifi.com Market voices on:

Russia maintains close ties with both Iran and Saudi Arabia, and Mr Putin on Wednesday credited the Moscow-Riyadh cooperation with stabilising global energy prices.
